metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9604 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
libavcodec/utvideodec.c in FFmpeg before 2.5.2 does not check for a zerovalue of a slice height, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds array access) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via crafted Ut Video data, related to the (1) restore_median and (2)restore_median_il functions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9604` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libav-tools - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavcodec-extra - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavcodec-extra-54 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavcodec54 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavdevice-extra-53 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavdevice53 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavfilter-extra-3 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavfilter3 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavformat-extra-54 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavformat54 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavresample1 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavutil-extra-52 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libavutil52 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libswscale-extra-2 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libswscale2 - 6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libav package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6:9.18-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
